page.title: 05CHESTER-LE-STREET A POEM
page.content:
In 1983 Chester-le-Street celebrated its 1100th Anniversary with a festival of activities and entertainments which emphasised its long historical connections.
In days gone by, The monks did bring St.Cuthberts body here To lay to rest,to leave his name, On the banks of the River Wear.
The daunting castle on the hill, Looking proudly down, On what is now a thriving, Busy town.
The steepled church,the market place, All the things we see, Chester-le-Street,O Chester-le-Street I will remember thee
